title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
content: The Israeli military published documents that it said showed cooperation between Al Jazeera and Hamas. The network denied the allegations, saying Israel wanted to “silence” its journalists.
summary: The Israeli military published documents that it said showed cooperation between Al Jazeera and Hamas. The network denied the allegations, saying Israel wanted to “silence” its journalists.

title: Why North Korea is sending soldiers to the Russian front lines
content: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.
summary: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.

title: People in northern Gaza running out of means to survive, U.N. says
content: Israel’s military assault has pushed the area to the edge of humanitarian collapse, aid officials say, after a near-total blockade on aid deliveries to the north.
summary: Israel’s military assault has pushed the area to the edge of humanitarian collapse, aid officials say, after a near-total blockade on aid deliveries to the north.

title: Putin does not deny presence of North Korean troops in Russia
content: The U.S. government said it had evidence that at least 3,000 North Korean soldiers were being trained in Russia.
summary: The U.S. government said it had evidence that at least 3,000 North Korean soldiers were being trained in Russia.

title: Canada to cut immigration levels in major reversal, Trudeau says
content: The U-turn, on an approach that has set Canada apart from the United States, comes as public support for immigration wanes.
summary: The U-turn, on an approach that has set Canada apart from the United States, comes as public support for immigration wanes.

title: Live Briefing: U.S. and Israel announce plan to resume Gaza cease-fire talks
content: U.S. and Israeli officials ae set for talks in Doha on a cease-fire and hostage deal, the U.S. secretary of state said. He announced $135 million in aid for Palestinians.
summary: U.S. and Israeli officials ae set for talks in Doha on a cease-fire and hostage deal, the U.S. secretary of state said. He announced $135 million in aid for Palestinians.

title: Mapped: Sites in Iran that Israel could strike
Mapped: Sites in Iran that Israel could strike
content: Iran is bracing for a retaliatory attack by Israel, which analysts say will probably target military sites rather than nuclear or oil facilities.
summary: Iran is bracing for a retaliatory attack by Israel, which analysts say will probably target military sites rather than nuclear or oil facilities.

title: Putin presents himself as champion of the developing world at summit
content: Russia was in the spotlight at the BRICS summit, but the organization of mostly developing nations is far from united behind Vladimir Putin’s agenda.
summary: Russia was in the spotlight at the BRICS summit, but the organization of mostly developing nations is far from united behind Vladimir Putin’s agenda.

title: Israel, U.S. announce efforts to negotiate cease-fire and hostage deal
Hezbollah proving a formidable foe against Israeli forces in Lebanon
content: The militant group has bounced back from major setbacks thanks to a flexible command structure, help from Iran and years of planning for an Israeli invasion.
summary: The militant group has bounced back from major setbacks thanks to a flexible command structure, help from Iran and years of planning for an Israeli invasion.

title: North Gaza faces ‘extraordinary challenges,’ Blinken says, as conditions worsen
36-year-old surfer dies after being impaled by sharp-billed fish
content: Italian surfer Giulia Manfrini was surfing in the Mentawai Islands when she was impaled by a swordfish, Indonesian authorities said. The resort said it was a needlefish.
summary: Italian surfer Giulia Manfrini was surfing in the Mentawai Islands when she was impaled by a swordfish, Indonesian authorities said. The resort said it was a needlefish.

title: Buildings destroyed as Israel continues to hit Beirut with airstrikes
Democrats and Republicans court overseas voters in tight election
content: Democrats and Republicans are urging U.S. citizens in far-flung areas — from Toronto to Tel Aviv — to cast absentee ballots.
summary: Democrats and Republicans are urging U.S. citizens in far-flung areas — from Toronto to Tel Aviv — to cast absentee ballots.

title: Sword with pharaoh’s mark found in Egypt, still shimmering 3,000 years later
content: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.
summary: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.

title: American views of China hit record low, poll finds, as animosity grows
content: A majority of Americans — 55 percent — say the United States should actively work to limit the growth of China’s power, according to a Chicago Council poll.
summary: A majority of Americans — 55 percent — say the United States should actively work to limit the growth of China’s power, according to a Chicago Council poll.

title: Al Jazeera condemns Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
Israeli attacks on Hezbollah financing show group’s reach in Lebanon
Blinken says ‘more progress’ from Israel needed on Gaza aid flow
content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting the Middle East. Israeli forces said they killed Hashem Safieddine, a top Hezbollah leader.
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting the Middle East. Israeli forces said they killed Hashem Safieddine, a top Hezbollah leader.

title: North Korean troops are in Russia, would be ‘legitimate targets’ in Ukraine, U.S. says
content: The Biden administration said that at least 3,000 North Korean troops are training in Russia, though it remains unclear if they’ll join the war.
summary: The Biden administration said that at least 3,000 North Korean troops are training in Russia, though it remains unclear if they’ll join the war.

title: Israeli attacks on Hezbollah financing show group’s reach in Lebanon
content: Al-Qard al-Hasan became an integral part of the financial fabric of Lebanon, first offering microloans to Hezbollah’s support base and then expanding services.
summary: Al-Qard al-Hasan became an integral part of the financial fabric of Lebanon, first offering microloans to Hezbollah’s support base and then expanding services.

title: Turkey says ‘terrorist attack’ on aerospace company leaves at least 5 dead, 22 injured
content: No group immediately claimed responsibility. Turkey’s interior minister said it was “most likely carried out” by the Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or PKK.
summary: No group immediately claimed responsibility. Turkey’s interior minister said it was “most likely carried out” by the Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or PKK.

title: American creating deepfakes targeting Harris works with Russian intel, documents show
content: Russian documents reviewed by The Post expose the workings of a Moscow network that has become a potent source of fake news targeting American voters.
summary: Russian documents reviewed by The Post expose the workings of a Moscow network that has become a potent source of fake news targeting American voters.

title: Northern Gaza conditions ‘beyond catastrophic,’ U.N. official says
Putin relishes role on stage, but Ukraine war looms over BRICS summit
content: The summit’s final document said little about the Ukraine war, but several participants were still searching for a way to end it diplomatically.
summary: The summit’s final document said little about the Ukraine war, but several participants were still searching for a way to end it diplomatically.

title: Hezbollah confirms death of official seen as Nasrallah successor
Israel strikes southern Lebanon and Beirut suburbs
Hostage families say Blinken meeting left them uncertain of cease-fire talks
19-year-old Walmart employee found dead inside walk-in oven
content: Police in eastern Canada said the woman was discovered inside the store’s bakery department oven. The cause and manner of death are under investigation.
summary: Police in eastern Canada said the woman was discovered inside the store’s bakery department oven. The cause and manner of death are under investigation.

title: U.K.’s Labour denies Trump campaign’s election interference claim
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer dismissed the claim that members of his party were making “illegal foreign national contributions” by volunteering for the Harris campaign.
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer dismissed the claim that members of his party were making “illegal foreign national contributions” by volunteering for the Harris campaign.

title: Putin is hosting the BRICS summit in Russia. What to know.
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is hosting leaders from China, India and other countries for the bloc’s first meeting since its expansion.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin is hosting leaders from China, India and other countries for the bloc’s first meeting since its expansion.

title: Blinken: Netanyahu says no plan to reoccupy Gaza with Jewish settlers
Meet Apollo, the Egyptian dog filmed atop a pyramid who charmed internet
content: A leader of a rescue group immediately recognized Apollo, one of millions of stray dogs in Egypt, barking at birds atop the Pyramid of Khafre.
summary: A leader of a rescue group immediately recognized Apollo, one of millions of stray dogs in Egypt, barking at birds atop the Pyramid of Khafre.

title: Netanyahu’s house damaged by drone, Israeli media reports
Vatican debate over women as deacons hits a big obstacle: Pope Francis
content: In the final days of the most significant Catholic gathering since the 1960s, the prospect of women being ordained appears off the table during Francis’s papacy.
summary: In the final days of the most significant Catholic gathering since the 1960s, the prospect of women being ordained appears off the table during Francis’s papacy.

title: The growing tension within the BRICS
content: Russia and China see the burgeoning bloc as a vehicle for confrontation with the West. Other influential member states are not so keen.
summary: Russia and China see the burgeoning bloc as a vehicle for confrontation with the West. Other influential member states are not so keen.

title: IDF confirms death of top Hezbollah leader; Blinken meets with Netanyahu
content: Many are feared to be missing under the rubble of Rafiq Hariri University Hospital, Lebanon’s Health Ministry said. Israel’s military said it hit a Hezbollah target.
summary: Many are feared to be missing under the rubble of Rafiq Hariri University Hospital, Lebanon’s Health Ministry said. Israel’s military said it hit a Hezbollah target.

title: Netanyahu’s house damaged by drone, Israeli media reports
Alejandro Toledo joins list of Peruvian presidents imprisoned for graft
content: Peru’s former president has been sentenced to serve more than 20 years on corruption charges, in the same prison that has housed other Peruvian leaders.
summary: Peru’s former president has been sentenced to serve more than 20 years on corruption charges, in the same prison that has housed other Peruvian leaders.
